body.p:
New Liberty Owen Co Ky
July 27 -- 1863
Gov -- Robinson
Dear Sir

Mr L. E. Krutz a citizen of our place who some time since resided in Carroll Co -- during his stay in Carroll he kept a hotell his license having expired -- and not having a chance (as I understand) to renew them -- during the autumn sold some whiskey by the small quantity -- was indicted and through the neglect of his lawyer (as he tells me) was fined sixty Dollars ^after taking also fees $20 -- leave $40^ Mr Krutz is a very good sort of a man -- has a large and helpless family -- he is a poor man wholy unable to pay the amount with^out^ destressing him and his family every body here would be glad to have his fine released -- I will take it as a very great favor govener if you will release him truly your friend J. B. English
